page.title: 09CONSERVATION.
page.content: The farmers are becoming, with the help of government incentives, much more aware of conservation. At the end of Gunnings Lane, on land belonging to Manor Farm, a reservoir has been dug to attract wild-life, a heron as well as mallards have been seen on it. Similarly the newly erected Grove Farm at the end of Broad Lane have dug a new pond, cleared an existing one, thinned out and re-planted the copse and put nesting boxes on the farm. Bishampton was selected as a major project area in the county for a "tree planting scheme" which helped to replace many dead elms.Jubilee Walk so named to commemorate the 25th anniversary of the Accession of H.M. Queen Elizabeth II in 1977, to the east of the village has numerous trees including mountain ash, oak, birch and hazel, planted in the bridalpath area.
